ratings.comment: I think Liu was quite organized, efficient and engaged in delivering his lecture materials. I did learn a lot from this class. There were lots of readings over the semester; writings were mostly based on these readings. I would recommend this class!!

Highly knowledgeable, passionate, and approachable. Ambiguous, difficult/dry course content, unclear/unrealistic expectations, and not engaging enough in some discussions. Too much material presented at times, with unclear explanations. Uncertain as to whether a whole course on occupations/professions is necessary. Would not recommend.

I would not say this is an easy class, even though some people may not have a big probelm getting AB or even A. Personally, I feel so regretful that I didn't finish all those assigned reading coz some of them are really inspiring. To those who have time for the reading, it would be a great course.

SOC 225 demands a lot of reading. The reading is challenging and very time consuming. Take notes when you read! I would not recommend this class to a friend, unless said friend is utterly fascinated by China.
Prof. Liu is very knowledgeable and explains things well. Lectures are fun and easy to follow. Only 2 take home exams. Good with emails and a really nice guy. TAKE!!
